query: I'm looking for songs by BTS, who are the most popular K-pop group globally. Can you find the collaboration track "Taeyang Vibe feat. Jimin of BTS" on Spotify? After finding it, I'd like to see links to this same song on other music platforms using the Spotify album URL.

final_answer.answer:
I found information about BTS and the collaboration track you're looking for. BTS is indeed a popular K-pop group that debuted on June 13, 2013, under Big Hit Entertainment. They have 7 members and their fanclub is called ARMY.

Regarding the specific song you asked about, I found that 'Vibe feat. Jimin of BTS' is a track by Taeyang released on January 13, 2023. The official music video can be found on YouTube at https://youtu.be/cXCBiF67jLM.

On Spotify, the song is titled 'VIBE (feat. Jimin of BTS)' and is part of Taeyang's album 'Down to Earth'. The Spotify track ID is 4NIe9Is7bN5JWyTeCW2ahK, and the album ID is 6uMu4poce5OdMd1HYglZux. You can access the album at https://open.spotify.com/album/6uMu4poce5OdMd1HYglZux.

Unfortunately, when I tried to find links to this song on other music platforms using the Spotify album URL, I encountered an error: 'Post url Error [ERR_FR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS]: Maximum number of redirects exceeded'. This means I wasn't able to retrieve links to the song on other platforms as requested.
final_answer.reason: The answer combines information from all tool calls, including successful data about BTS as a group, confirmation of the song's existence, and Spotify details. The error from the music links API is explicitly mentioned as it's important to explain why part of the user's request couldn't be fulfilled. Even with this limitation, the answer provides comprehensive information about what was successfully found.

query: I want to find information about the K-pop group EXO. First, can you search for them in the boy groups database? Then find their songs as an artist. After that, search specifically for their track "Don't Fight The Feeling" which I believe was their most recent full group comeback. final_answer.answer:
I found comprehensive information about the K-pop group EXO:

1. Boy Group Database Results:
EXO is a K-pop boy group that debuted on April 8, 2012, under SM Entertainment. They currently have 9 active members, though they originally started with 12 members. Their official fan club is called EXO-L, and they are still active in the industry.

2. Songs Database Results:
I found multiple songs by EXO and its members in the database. As you specifically mentioned, 'Don't Fight The Feeling' was indeed released on June 7, 2021. This appears to be their most recent full group comeback as you suggested. The Korean title is '돈트 파이트 더 필링' and the music video is available at: https://youtu.be/2IkoKhr6Tss

Other notable releases include solo works by EXO members:
- Chen's 'Last Scene' (November 14, 2022)
- Xiumin's 'Brand New' (September 26, 2022)
- Chen's 'Hello' (October 15, 2020)

3. Spotify Search Results:
I successfully located 'Don't Fight The Feeling' on Spotify. It's part of their special album titled "DON'T FIGHT THE FEELING - Special Album" with Spotify ID: 7Jw48lPmYuYftfQv5LmAzI
The album is available at: https://open.spotify.com/album/7Jw48lPmYuYftfQv5LmAzI

4. Music Links API Results:
Unfortunately, when trying to find links to this song across different music platforms using the Spotify album URL, the API returned an error: 'Post url Error [ERR_FR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS]: Maximum number of redirects exceeded'. This means I couldn't retrieve links to the song on other music platforms.

final_answer.answer:
I found information about SEVENTEEN and their song 'Left & Right'. Here's what I discovered:

SEVENTEEN is indeed a K-pop boy group with 13 members (the largest number in a major K-pop boy group). They debuted on May 26, 2015, under Pledis Entertainment. Their fanclub is called 'Carat' and they're still active.

Regarding 'Left & Right', I found it on Spotify. It's a track from their album 'Heng:garæ'. The Spotify track ID is '5QGooKayQPVZMUDc8Qt3Dm' and it's 3 minutes and 21 seconds long (201,773 milliseconds).

However, when searching through their songs database, I didn't see 'Left & Right' with a listed director in the results. The search returned several SEVENTEEN songs including 'Smile Flower' (Korean name: '웃음꽃'), 'Not Alone', 'Highlight' (Korean name: '하이라이트'), and others, but the specific song 'Left & Right' with director information wasn't found in the returned data.

When I attempted to find where else you can listen to this track on other music platforms using the Spotify album sharing URL (https://open.spotify.com/album/3q6lN3kfsDgGaQUC7kVASH), the music links API returned an error: 'Post url Error [ERR_FR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS]: Maximum number of redirects exceeded'. This means I couldn't retrieve information about other platforms where the song is available.

I noted that the director information wasn't found in the K-pop songs database results, and I included the error from the music links API as meaningful information that explains why I couldn't provide alternative platforms for listening to the song.

query: I'm a big fan of SEVENTEEN, which I've heard is the K-pop group with the largest number of members. Could you first find information about SEVENTEEN as a boy group, then search for songs by Seventeen? After that, I'm also interested in finding some jazz classics tracks on Spotify. Once you find them, could you use the link for the Coffee & Jazz album to discover where else I can listen to this music on other platforms?

final_answer.answer:
I found information about SEVENTEEN as a K-pop boy group. According to the data, SEVENTEEN (also known as SVT or 세븐틴 in Korean) debuted on May 26, 2015, under Pledis Entertainment. They do indeed have 13 members, which confirms they are one of the K-pop groups with a large number of members. Their fanclub is called 'Carat' and the group is currently active.

When I searched for songs by SEVENTEEN in the K-pop database, unfortunately no results were returned. This could be due to limitations in the database or how the search was performed.

Regarding your interest in jazz classics on Spotify, I found that there are 919 tracks matching 'jazz classics' on Spotify. One notable result is a track called 'Jazz Classic' from the album 'Coffee & Jazz' by the artist 'Cafe Music BGM channel'.

When I attempted to find where else you can listen to the 'Coffee & Jazz' album on other platforms using the link, I encountered an error: 'Post url Error [ERR_FR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS]: Maximum number of redirects exceeded'. This means the system was unable to successfully follow the link to find alternative platforms for this music.
final_answer.reason: The answer combines the successful findings about SEVENTEEN as a group with the acknowledgment that no songs were found in the database. For the jazz classics search, I included the count of tracks found and highlighted a specific example. I also explained the error encountered when trying to find alternative platforms, which is important information for the user to understand why that part of their request couldn't be fulfilled.

However, I couldn't retrieve specific details about ARA due to technical limitations with the Spotify API.

query: I'm interested in Brazilian music. Can you find radio stations in Brazil, then show me the channels starting with the first page? I'd like to search for artists on Spotify related to Arara Azul FM, which I've heard plays great local music. Once you find the results, could you get me detailed information about the artist Arara?

final_answer.answer:
I found information about Brazilian radio stations and searched for artists related to Arara Azul FM on Spotify. Here's what I discovered:

1. Brazil is confirmed as a country in the radio stations database (ID: 12).

2. I found Arara Azul FM among the Brazilian radio stations (ID: 582). This station plays Adult Contemporary, Italian, and Pop music according to its genre tags. The station has a logo available in various sizes.

3. When searching Spotify for 'Arara Azul FM', I found 12 related artists. The first artist listed is simply named 'Arara', and their profile picture is available at various resolutions.

4. Unfortunately, when I tried to get detailed information about the artist 'Arara', the Spotify API was unreachable. The system returned an error message stating: 'The API is unreachable, please contact the API provider' with additional information indicating that while the client and gateway are working, the API itself is not functioning.

So while I can confirm that Arara Azul FM exists as a Brazilian radio station and there is an artist named 'Arara' on Spotify that appears in searches related to your query, I couldn't retrieve detailed information about this artist due to a technical issue with the Spotify API.
final_answer.reason: The answer synthesizes all available information from the tool calls, clearly indicating both successful findings (Brazilian radio stations list, Arara Azul FM details, and Spotify search results) and the API error that prevented getting detailed artist information. The error message is included as meaningful information that explains why part of the query couldn't be fulfilled.

query: I'm interested in Brazilian radio stations. Can you help me find channels from Brazil and then search for Pop Rock artists on Spotify? After that, I'd like to get detailed information about Pop Evil specifically.

I've found information about Brazilian radio stations and Pop Rock artists on Spotify, but encountered an issue when trying to get details about Pop Evil specifically.

I successfully found that Brazil is available in the radio stations database (country ID: 12). When searching for Brazilian radio stations, I found at least 30 channels (with more available as indicated by 'has_next': True). The first station in the results is 'Arara Azul FM', which features Adult Contemporary, Italian, and Pop genres. The results were truncated, but there are many more Brazilian stations available.

2. Pop Rock Artists on Spotify:
I searched Spotify for 'Pop Rock' and found 901 artists matching this genre. Among the top results was Pop Evil, which is the artist you specifically asked about. Other Pop Rock artists in the results included Chappell Roan. The full list was truncated but contained many more artists.

3. Pop Evil Details:
Unfortunately, when I attempted to get detailed information about Pop Evil specifically, the Spotify API was unreachable. The system returned an error message: 'The API is unreachable, please contact the API provider' with additional information indicating that while the client and gateway are working, the API itself is not responding.

To summarize: I can confirm that Brazil has numerous radio stations available in the database, and Pop Evil is indeed a Pop Rock artist on Spotify. However, I couldn't retrieve detailed information about Pop Evil due to an API connectivity issue.

query: I'm interested in Brazilian radio stations. Can you help me find radio stations in Brazil, then check what rock music stations they have on page 1? After that, search Spotify for rock artists, and get me detailed information about Rockout Danny - his profile seems the most distinctive among rock artists.

final_answer.answer:
I've gathered information about Brazilian radio stations and searched for rock music content as requested. Here's what I found:

1. Brazilian Radio Stations:
   - Successfully confirmed Brazil is available in the radio stations database (country ID: 12).
   - Retrieved the first page of Brazilian radio stations, which shows 30 results out of a larger total.
   - The first station listed is 'Arara Azul FM' which features Adult Contemporary, Italian, and Pop genres.
   - The results indicate there are more pages available (has_next: True).

However, I don't see any specifically rock-focused stations in the first page of results that were returned. The genres shown for Arara Azul FM are Adult Contemporary, Italian, and Pop - not rock.

2. Spotify Search for Rock Artists:
   - Successfully searched Spotify for rock artists and found 108 total results.
   - The first artist returned was 'Rockout Danny' as you mentioned.
   - Other rock artists included 'Rockabye Baby!' and others that were truncated in the results.

3. Detailed Information about Rockout Danny:
   - Unfortunately, when I tried to get detailed information about Rockout Danny, the Spotify API was unreachable.
   - The system returned an error message: 'The API is unreachable, please contact the API provider'.

In summary, I was able to find Brazilian radio stations and confirm that Rockout Danny exists as a rock artist on Spotify, but I couldn't retrieve his detailed profile information due to an API issue. If you'd like, I can try again later to get those details or focus on exploring more Brazilian rock radio stations specifically.
final_answer.reason: The answer synthesizes all available information from the tool calls, clearly indicating both successful results (finding Brazilian radio stations and rock artists on Spotify) and unsuccessful attempts (getting Rockout Danny's details). I've maintained transparency about the API error and explained what information was and wasn't available in the results, while still providing the user with the information that was successfully retrieved.

query: Show me the Billboard Artist 100 chart from November 1, 2023, then find all songs by the artist with the shortest name on that chart. After that, get snippets for Halsey's song "Without Me", and finally search for the full lyrics of "Without Me" on Genius charts using the all-time filter, showing 20 results on the first page.

final_answer.answer:
I analyzed the Billboard Artist 100 chart from November 1, 2023, and found the following results:

The Billboard Artist 100 chart showed Taylor Swift at #1, followed by blink-182 at #2, The Rolling Stones at #3, Drake at #4, and Morgan Wallen at #5. Looking at the entire chart, the artist with the shortest name is Drake (5 letters).

When attempting to find all songs by Drake (the artist with the shortest name), the tool failed to execute this search properly.

For Halsey's song 'Without Me', I successfully retrieved lyric snippets which include lines such as:
- 'Found you when your heart was broke, I filled your cup until it overflowed'
- 'Took it so far to keep you close (Keep you close), I was afraid to leave you on your own (Ooh)'
- 'Tell me, how's it feel sittin' up there? Feeling so high, but too far away to hold me'
- 'You know I'm the one who put you up there, Name in the sky, does it ever get lonely?'

Finally, when attempting to search for the full lyrics of 'Without Me' on Genius charts using the all-time filter, the tool returned an error message: 'Invalid value for chart_genre'. This means the search parameters provided were not accepted by the Genius API.
final_answer.reason: I provided a comprehensive answer by analyzing each tool result: (1) successfully identified the Billboard Artist 100 chart and determined Drake had the shortest name, (2) acknowledged the failure to retrieve Drake's songs, (3) included key snippets from Halsey's 'Without Me', and (4) explained the error encountered when trying to search Genius charts. Each result, including errors and failures, provides meaningful information about what was attempted and what was or wasn't found.

After seeing her songs, can you show me snippets of Halsey's "Without Me" track? Then I want to find the full lyrics for "Without Me" on the Genius charts, looking at all-time rankings with 10 results on the first page.

final_answer.answer:
Based on the Billboard Artist 100 chart from October 15, 2023, Taylor Swift was the top female artist, ranking at #2 overall (with Drake at #1). Olivia Rodrigo was the second highest female artist at #4 overall. Unfortunately, SZA did not appear in the visible portion of the results that were returned.

Regarding your interest in SZA's songs, the tool execution did not include a search for SZA's music, so I cannot provide information about her songs based on the available data.

For Halsey's 'Without Me' track, I can share that the lyric snippets tool successfully returned several key portions of the song, including the opening lines 'Found you when your heart was broke/I filled your cup until it overflowed' and other significant parts of the chorus like 'Tell me, how's it feel sittin' up there?/Feeling so high, but too far away to hold me' and 'You know I'm the one who put you up there/Name in the sky, does it ever get lonely?'

When attempting to find the full lyrics for 'Without Me' on the Genius charts with all-time rankings, the tool returned an error message indicating 'Invalid value for chart_genre'. This means the request to view the Genius chart rankings was not successful due to an incorrect parameter.
final_answer.reason: The answer compiles all available information from the successful tool calls while acknowledging the limitations and errors. It identifies Taylor Swift and Olivia Rodrigo as top female artists from the Billboard data, notes the absence of SZA in the visible results, provides some non-copyrighted snippets from Halsey's 'Without Me' track, and explains why the Genius chart search failed. The 'not found' results for SZA and the error with the Genius chart are included as they provide important context about what information could not be retrieved.

query: I'm looking for popular artists on the Billboard Artist 100 chart from May 12, 2023. Can you find an artist with a contemporary R&B sound similar to Halsey? Once you find that artist, show me all their songs. Then, I'd like to see some lyric snippets for Halsey's "Without Me" since it's one of her most popular songs. Finally, can you search the Genius lyrics chart for "Without Me" from the past week, showing 20 results on the first page?

final_answer.answer:
Based on the Billboard Artist 100 chart from May 12, 2023, I found that SZA was ranked #5 on the chart. SZA is known for her contemporary R&B sound and would be similar to Halsey in that regard. Unfortunately, when I attempted to retrieve SZA's songs, the tool failed after 5 attempts, so I cannot provide a list of her songs.

For Halsey's 'Without Me' lyrics, I was able to retrieve several snippets including:
- 'Found you when your heart was broke, I filled your cup until it overflowed'
- 'Took it so far to keep you close (Keep you close), I was afraid to leave you on your own (Ooh)'
- 'I said I'd catch you if you fall (Fall), And if they laugh, then fuck 'em all (All)'
- 'And then I got you off your knees, Put you right back on your feet, Just so you could take advantage of me'

When attempting to search the Genius lyrics chart for 'Without Me' from the past week, the tool returned an error message stating 'Invalid value for chart_genre'. This means the search could not be completed with the parameters provided.
final_answer.reason: I identified SZA as a contemporary R&B artist similar to Halsey on the Billboard Artist 100 chart. I clearly noted the tool failure when trying to retrieve SZA's songs. I provided several lyric snippets from Halsey's 'Without Me' as requested, and explained that the Genius chart search failed due to an invalid parameter. Each tool result (successful or not) was addressed in the answer.

It's important to note that these lyrics appear to be from Halsey's song 'Without Me', not SZA's. The tool may have defaulted to Halsey's version of the song with the same title.

query: What was the #1 song on the Billboard Hot 100 chart on October 15, 2023? Once you find it, can you search for it on Shazam and then look up the lyrics on Genius? I'm particularly interested in Drake's newest hit.

final_answer.answer:
The #1 song on the Billboard Hot 100 chart on October 15, 2023 was 'First Person Shooter' by Drake featuring J. Cole. This was indeed Drake's newest hit at the time, as it was in its first week on the chart (indicated by 'weeks_on_chart': '1'). The song debuted at the #1 position.

I was able to find the song on Shazam, where it's listed as 'First Person Shooter (feat. J. Cole)' by Drake with the key '679889253'. Shazam has additional information about the track including sharing links and images.

Unfortunately, I wasn't able to look up the lyrics on Genius as requested because the Genius - Song Lyrics search tool failed with the error message 'Tool not found in available tools'. This means I cannot provide the lyrics information you requested.
final_answer.reason: The answer combines successful results from the Billboard Hot 100 tool (showing 'First Person Shooter' as #1) and the Shazam search (confirming the song exists in their database), while acknowledging the failure of the Genius lyrics search. The 'not found' result for lyrics is meaningful because it explains why that part of the query couldn't be fulfilled, providing complete transparency about what information is and isn't available.

I heard Kate Bush's "Running Up That Hill (A Deal With God)" had a cultural resurgence recently. Can you search for it on Shazam using English settings and show me the top 5 results? Then I'd like to find the lyrics for this song on Genius.

final_answer.answer:
Based on the Billboard Hot 100 chart for July 15, 2022, Kate Bush's 'Running Up That Hill (A Deal With God)' was indeed on the chart, though the exact position was truncated in the results. The top 3 songs at that time were:

1. 'As It Was' by Harry Styles
2. 'About Damn Time' by Lizzo
3. 'First Class' by Jack Harlow

When searching for 'Running Up That Hill (A Deal With God)' on Shazam, the search was successful and returned results that included Kate Bush's song. The first result showed the song with the full title 'Running Up That Hill (A Deal With God)' by Kate Bush, confirming its popularity and cultural resurgence around that time.

Unfortunately, I couldn't retrieve the lyrics from Genius as requested because the Genius - Song Lyrics: Search tool was not available among the tools I can access. The system returned an error stating 'Tool not found in available tools' when attempting to use this service.
final_answer.reason: The answer provides the Billboard chart information that was successfully retrieved, confirming Kate Bush's song was on the chart in mid-July 2022. It also confirms the Shazam search was successful, showing the song was indeed popular enough to be a top result. The failure to retrieve lyrics from Genius is clearly explained as a tool availability issue rather than a data issue, which is important context for the user to understand why that part of their request couldn't be fulfilled.

query: I'm curious about a song that's been climbing the Billboard Hot 100 charts recently. Can you check the Hot 100 chart from September 15, 2023, and find the song with the longest chart presence that's currently trending upward? Then search for that song on Shazam with locale set to English US and limit to 5 results. After that, I'd like to find the lyrics for the song.

final_answer.answer:
Based on the Billboard Hot 100 chart from September 15, 2023, I found that 'Cruel Summer' by Taylor Swift is the song with the longest chart presence that was trending upward. The song was at rank #4, up from #5 the previous week, and had been on the chart for a significant period (though the exact weeks were truncated in the data). Taylor Swift's 'Cruel Summer' was showing upward momentum with an award designation.

I then searched for this song on Shazam with locale set to English US and limited to 5 results. The search was successful and returned 'Cruel Summer' by Taylor Swift as a result. The Shazam data confirmed this is the same song, providing additional details including sharing links and images.

Unfortunately, I was unable to find the lyrics for 'Cruel Summer' as requested. The attempt to use the Genius - Song Lyrics search tool failed with an error message indicating that this tool was not available among the accessible tools. Therefore, I cannot provide the lyrics for the song as part of this response.
final_answer.reason: The answer identifies Taylor Swift's 'Cruel Summer' as meeting the criteria of longest chart presence with upward momentum, confirms its existence on Shazam, but acknowledges the failure to retrieve lyrics due to tool unavailability. final_answer.answer:
I've gathered information about the song 'Running Up That Hill (A Deal With God)' by Kate Bush that was featured in Stranger Things and has had a major comeback.

First, I checked the Billboard Hot 100 chart from July 15, 2022, and found that Kate Bush's 'Running Up That Hill' was indeed on the chart. The tool results were truncated, but they confirmed the song was present on the Hot 100 during that time period, showing its significant comeback decades after its original release.

Next, I searched Shazam for the song and found it successfully. The Shazam results show 'Running Up That Hill (A Deal With God)' by Kate Bush, confirming it's a widely recognized track in their database. The results included sharing links and images associated with the song.

Unfortunately, I wasn't able to retrieve the lyrics from Genius as requested. The Genius lyrics search tool failed with an error message stating 'Tool 'Genius - Song Lyrics: Search' not found in available tools.' This means I cannot provide you with the lyrics at this time.

To summarize: The song 'Running Up That Hill (A Deal With God)' by Kate Bush was indeed on the Billboard Hot 100 in July 2022, confirming its comeback success after being featured in Stranger Things. While I found the song on Shazam, I couldn't retrieve the lyrics due to a tool error.

sequence_name: YouTube Music Trend to Spotify Profile

query: I want to check out what's trending on YouTube Music in Canada right now, then find the official page for Eminem, and search for his most recent album "The Death of Slim Shady (Coup De Grâce)" on Spotify to see his artist profile.

final_answer.answer:
I attempted to check what's trending on YouTube Music in Canada, find Eminem's official page, and search for his album on Spotify. Here are the results:

1. YouTube Music Trends (Canada): Unfortunately, the API request timed out with the message: 'The request to the API has timed out. Please try again later, or if the issue persists, please contact the API provider.' This means I couldn't retrieve the current trending music in Canada.

2. Eminem's YouTube Music Page: I successfully found Eminem's artist information on YouTube Music. His page shows several albums including 'The Marshall Mathers LP (25th Anniversary)' and other releases. The data includes album thumbnails and browsing IDs, confirming I located his official artist page.

3. Spotify Search for 'The Death of Slim Shady (Coup De Grâce)': The search was successful and returned Eminem's artist profile on Spotify (URI: spotify:artist:7dGJo4pcD2V6oG8kP0tJRR). His profile includes avatar images at various resolutions. The search also returned other artists like Dr. Dre, though the full results were truncated in the output.

In summary, while I couldn't show you what's trending on YouTube Music in Canada due to a timeout error, I was able to locate Eminem's official page on YouTube Music showing his albums, and I found his artist profile on Spotify when searching for 'The Death of Slim Shady (Coup De Grâce)'. The album itself wasn't specifically mentioned in the truncated results, but Eminem's artist profile was successfully located.
final_answer.reason: The answer accurately reports the results from each tool call, including the timeout error from the first API call as valid information. It details what was found in the successful calls (Eminem's YouTube Music page and Spotify profile) while acknowledging limitations in the data (API timeout and truncated results). This provides a comprehensive response to all parts of the user's query, treating both successful and unsuccessful results as meaningful information.

query: What are the trending artists on YouTube Music in Brazil right now? I'd like to see who's gaining popularity, specifically anyone with an upward trend. After finding such an artist, please show me their official YouTube page. Then search for their album "O Tempo é Cura" on Spotify to see their artist profile there.

final_answer.answer:
Based on the YouTube Music trends in Brazil, I found several trending artists, but none specifically showed an 'upward' trend in the data provided. The top two trending artists in Brazil right now are:

1. Henrique & Juliano (ranked #1 with 16.8M subscribers) - trend status: neutral
2. MC Ryan SP (ranked #2 with 1.49M subscribers) - trend status: neutral

I was able to retrieve more details about MC Ryan SP, including some of his albums like 'Levada do 2T' and '2T Na Levada'. However, I couldn't find an album titled 'O Tempo é Cura' associated with MC Ryan SP.

When searching Spotify for 'O Tempo é Cura', the search returned results that appear to be related to an artist named Tim Bernardes, not MC Ryan SP. Tim Bernardes has a Spotify profile with the URI 'spotify:artist:5SVFuUaS3BKAdJs6I8rVa4'.

It seems that 'O Tempo é Cura' might be an album or song by Tim Bernardes rather than by any of the currently trending YouTube Music artists in Brazil.
final_answer.reason: The answer synthesizes the three tool calls: (1) YouTube Music trends showing top artists in Brazil with Henrique & Juliano and MC Ryan SP at the top, but none with an 'upward' trend, (2) Details about MC Ryan SP's albums which didn't include 'O Tempo é Cura', and (3) A Spotify search that found 'O Tempo é Cura' associated with Tim Bernardes instead. The 'not found' result for an upward-trending artist is meaningful as it indicates all trending artists currently have neutral trends according to the data.

query: I'm looking for Ed Sheeran's "Shape of You" on SoundCloud. Can you find the track, then get detailed metadata for it using the official SoundCloud URL, and finally download the timed lyrics by matching it with the third candidate on Spotify? I want the lyrics for track 301161123 since it has over 12,000 comments and is one of his most popular songs from 2017.

final_answer.answer:
I successfully found Ed Sheeran's 'Shape of You' on SoundCloud and retrieved the detailed metadata and timed lyrics as requested. Here's what I found:

1. SoundCloud Search Results:
   - Successfully located 'Shape of You' by Ed Sheeran
   - URL: https://soundcloud.com/edsheeran/shape-of-you
   - Duration: 233.759 seconds (approximately 3:53)

2. Track Metadata from SoundCloud:
   - Confirmed this is track ID 301161123 as you mentioned
   - The track has two audio quality options available (mp3 and opus formats)
   - Duration matches the search result at approximately 3:53

3. Timed Lyrics:
   - Successfully retrieved the synchronized lyrics from Spotify (third candidate match as requested)
   - The lyrics are time-stamped, starting at [00:09.77] with "The club isn't the best place to find a lover"
   - The lyrics continue throughout the song with precise timestamps

The track you specified (301161123) was indeed found and appears to be the official version from Ed Sheeran's SoundCloud account, matching your description as one of his most popular songs from 2017.
final_answer.reason: The answer provides a comprehensive summary of all three successful tool calls. I confirmed finding the exact track ID 301161123 as specified in the query, verified it was on SoundCloud, retrieved its metadata, and successfully obtained the timed lyrics by matching with Spotify as requested. I organized the information clearly by tool result while avoiding reproducing the full copyrighted lyrics.
